Name: Casio MS-80B Standard Function Desktop Calculator

ReviewList.Text: This calculator is the best calculator I have ever used, period. The screen is bright, the battery lasts long (over a year at the least, and I use this calc everyday), and the buttons are big. For around $12, the quality of this calculator far surpasses its price point because I've seen pricier ones that are just fancy pants calculators that do the same thing. This one is sleek and very nicely designed. The buttons are also housed in a sturdy plastic case, which makes it really durable easy to handle. Love it!

This is the best desk calculator I have had.  I've ordered one for myself, one for my husband, and several for friends.  It has 2 power sources (solar and battery) and the battery seems to last for years.  The keys are large as is the display and the price is phenomenally low for the quality and usefulness of this product.

This is a great basic calculator. The buttons are big and easy to hit, and the numbers always register. I have to compile pages of export statistics every month so if I press a button but the numeral doesn't register it is a major headache for me. I also like how everything is easy to read. If you are a nuclear scientist or something you would probably need a more advanced calculator. However, if you are doing basic math, I think you'll like this calculator.

A nice desk calculator that I use often. I bought another one for my son too. I've used it regularly for a long time (at least 9 months) and there have been no issues with the battery or function. It's easy to use and seems like it was quality made. Good buy for the price.

It appears that the % key is only usable for tax and currency calculations which makes it worthless for my use. I am used to using the % key as follows: 25-10(% key)=22.50. I have never had a calculator that didn't have a % key that worked that way. If I am just slow on the uptake, then show me my error and I will change my review.

This is a great simple calculator. Numbers are displayed large and bold. The buttons are plastic and click when pressed (so you don't have to press down on rubber like those crappy dollar store calculators). It also displays comma separators at the thousand and million mark. I haven't had any issues so far with the battery. The Tax+/Tax- feature is programmable (local sales tax where I live is 7% -- I updated my calculator to that instead of the standard 5%). It bothers me a little that you can't input numbers quickly, though. If you're using it too fast, it'll only pick up every other number. Other than that, great product!

I am very pleased with the size and performance of this calculator. Perfect for my desk. So far, the only issue I have is the lack of a CE, or clear entry, or "backspace" function so that if, in adding a column of numbers, I mis-key one, I can just delete it and continue without losing all the data. Maybe it has that function somehow, but it is not mentioned in the booklet, etc.
Finally I found a calculator that has big buttons and a large readout.  You don't have to worry about hitting the wrong key by mistake with this one.  We love it.

This is the coolest thing. You put in several numbers and it adds them together for you. Unbelievable. I am probably going to auction my abacus and slide rule. I had a similar experience when I got married and threw out my encyclopedia. Didn't need it. My wife knew everything.

I have six of these calculators around the home; home office, travel bag, etc,but at the moment I have another brand in front of me.That's how popular the calculator is around here.Button (aka coin) type batteries are pre installed from the factory.I press the '8' key till the display is full of '8's then cover the solar panel.**If the display goes dim, time to change the batteries.Unscrew the two screws on the back with mini philips screwdriver.GENTLY pry the sides with butter knife or something even more dull.(know anyone who got to the insides of the smart phones, they have a tooljust for that operation)Gently push the battery out of the contacts, make note of thebattery type (ie CR 2032, CR 2016, LR 44)Install fresh one purchased from Tergat, Wal M., if not availabletry Radio Sack, or any super market.Snap sides together, drive in the screws. Done.Back in business.:)- update - June 18 2014**Without batteries, calculator will work with solar panel under a desk lamp.But no one turns on desk lamp in a room when it is a full daylight outside,but the outside light which is great for reading will not be enough for the calculatorto work properly.

The 4,5,6 keys stopped working after about 6 weeks. You can push down on these 3 keys but the numbers are not registered on the display. Not what I would have expected. Maybe it's just a cheap product.

I was looking for a new calculator to use at my desk at work and decided upon this one.  This is a solid calculator with a low profile that will help reduce hand strain. The buttons are hard plastic which I prefer over rubber buttons that some other calculators use. The hard plastic gives a solid feel, so you know when you push a button, it registered.  The display is tilted up toward the user at a slight angle but is not adjustable. However, he viewing angle of the display is good even when the calculator is several feet away.The bottom of the calculator has two rubber feet to prevent the calculator from moving on the desk. The bottom edges are curved which feels comfortable if you are holding the calculator in your hand while using it.I experimented with the currency exchange mode and it works, but I will not use it often. I do like the tax rate feature which will come in handy for calculating sales tax.The calculator does come with some very basic instructions, but this is not a problem since this is a fairly simple calculator to use.The calculator switches from solar power to battery power without any indication. This is good since your data will never be lost. It is easy to change the battery by removing two phillips head screws from the back of the calculator.I will be using this calculator dozens of times a day at the office and feel that it is a great value. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a small desktop calculator.  Very pleased with this purchase!
This is a nice calculator with large buttons and easy to use.  The product dimensions listed are incorrect.  The unit is 4" wide and 5 3/8" tall.  See correct specs on the Casio website:  [...]
only parts of the numbers show up on the display.  Broken when I got it. Don't want to send it back, it would be more than shipping than it is worth.

After my faithful Casio calculator's button battery failed, (it's also solar assisted). I decided to throw it away, figuring a new battery would cost almost as much as a new one. Big mistake, couldn't find it locally; the lookalike, bought at a big national drug store turned out to be, just that, a cheap copy. The  LED display was hard to read, the keyboard buttons had to be pressed really hard in order to work. I'm really glad , a same model no. was found in Amazon for a reasonable price, (bought two). The bad copy will be kept in my shop for occasional use. Second review:  Of the two I bought the second one was opened today , may 12 2014, to my surprise it isn't working properly, Casio customer relations was most helpful through internet, but returning an item that costs less than ten dollars for replacement is a waste of my valuable time. So i guess the five stars go to the ones that work properly.

My old calculator was shrinking or maybe I'm just aging. I needed something with numbers that are easier to hit and be error free. It does make a clicking sound with the push of each numeral which does not bother me at all. That will alert me if the number does not register. It is not an item of beauty. In fact it is far from that. It looks cheap. But that is not why I purchased it. Perhaps the best thing is that it is not made in China! Hooray!  It isn't made in the USA either. Remember 30 years ago when we thought the stuff Made in Japan was cheaply made. Now they look great. And Japan is where these are made. So if you were in WWII, don't buy it.  After using this a few days I have decided is too big for me now. (May be useful in 5-10 years)  the size slows down my calculations. I still recommend it if you need a simple calculator.

Gave this 4 stars rather than 5 stars because it lacked an "off " switch. Also, for the size thought it should have 9 digit display capability instead of 8 digits. After 8 minutes of non-use it shuts down automatically. I'm old-fashioned, I like an on/off switch. Everything else is great, large keyboard numbers, easy to read display. I bought this one because it had the tax rate function and two-way power. I, also bought the Casio SL-300SV solar powered standard function calculator at the same time. Use it more often than the MS-80S. The MS-80S is good for desktop use or to carry in a briefcase, but not in your pocket. I expect both calculators will last a long time and are a bargain at these prices.

This calculator is exactly what it looks like, which is fine and decent, with one huge flaw: it doesn't know about operation precedence. That is, if you type 7 + 3 * 10, the calculator evaluates (7 + 3) * 10 = 100, not 7 + (3 * 10) = 37, which is correct and how proper calculators operate. So you can make serious mistakes if you just type in a string of numbers and operators from another document.

The web page on Amazon is not accurate about the dimensions of the calculator, as someone else pointed out.  I think the measurements that are stated on the web page are the measurements of the cardboard card and plastic that it comes in.  The calculator is 5.5" by 4" by 0.5".  I was expecting something larger, but this size is fine, and it's the size of the one I was replacing.

This appears to be a quality, well-made calculator, but the saltine-sized page of instruction that came with it is next to worthless. Also, although it is capable of being battery powered, it is not at all apparent how to add or change a battery - there are just two tiny screws on the upper back side of the housing.

Sometimes you don't need anything that's too fancy or complicated or expensive. Although I could use the app on my smart phone to calculate, it's not as user-friendly as this classic Casio. Big buttons, big numbers, big screen all make this calculator work well. Thanks, Casio, for getting it right!

good so far, taking one start off only because it auto turn off is a bit faster than i thought.I wish it will stay on for at least 5min before it auto turn off. although i didnt do a count down measure how long beforeit auto turn off. but i think around 2-3mins.

This calculator is exactly what I was looking for. The buttons are large enough and respond to the touch without clicking or having to push too hard. The unit is nicely designed with the screen elevated slightly. It's lighweight and not too bulky. Love this calculator.

i bought this to replace a $4 office depot brand calculator. i didn't buy it for features - it's a calculator. i bought it because the casio is much better quality, and allows me to work much faster. it has a heavier feel and that makes it well worth $8.

I needed a simple basic calculator for my desk.  This fits the bill.  They keys are easy to push; the screen is easy to read.  I just wish my kids didn't always steal it from my desk, but I can't blame the calculator for that.

The "price is right" - it adds, subtracts, multiplies and divides as well as I do but it take me longer without the MS-80S - suspect the MS-80S is more accurate over the long haul.  Oh yes, and it came quickly!

I just received and used this calculator, and it's a steal. It replaces a much pricier HP 12C Platinum Calculator, which I'd gotten about five years ago when I needed the more advanced functions. I'd bought two of the HP 12C's, to have one as backup, and they were nothing like the 12Cs of before -- the keys malfunctioned on both of the 12Cs within just 25-50 uses (sticking and more often, not registering at all) and there was no easy fix. I've been tolerating them for the last few years, assuming that was just how calculators were made these days, but finally had enough.I just need basic calculator functions now, and for that, the Casio MS-80B is perfect. The interface is incredibly user friendly, the keys work flawlessly (so far), the display is large and clear, and the solar power is a bonus.I also wanted to clear up several question re: the MS-80B's keypad functions. This model does indeed have both an 'off' key and a delete/backspace key, which prior reviews said this calculator doesn't have. The picture currently displayed on Amazon's official product page (as of this review, 6/21/15) is wrong and shows model MS-80S, which lacks these two functions. It's possible that prior reviewers got the wrong model (?).The MS-80B has both an off key and a delete/backspace key, which sit on the top row of the keypad. The backspace key looks like a right-pointing arrow. I've attached a photo of the MS-80B so you can see for yourself.In sum, this is a great basic calculator, for an amazing price. I did a quick search of the other basic models available on Amazon, and this appears to be the best in terms of value, build, and reviews. I can't speak to its long-term durability, but for this price, I don't think you can go wrong!
It's a very simple calculator I love, everyone else in the house thinks so to that's why this is now my third one.  It's a pain just trying to keep one on my desk!

I bought this to replace the almost exact same model Casio calculator that I have had for 17 years. The old one still worked but keys were getting sticky.  I used it on my very busy loan officer desk for 17 years, spilled coffee, soda, and ice cream on it and it still worked! After I got the new one I felt curious to see if I could open the calculator case to make the keys work better. The case popped open with 2 screws and a couple of easy catches. Inside was a silicone pad under the keys. I wiped off the underside of the keys and washed the silicone pad and the reassembled calculator works perfect, like new!!! I gave the old calculator to the granddaughters and they love it. I think I paid 7 or 8 bucks for this calculator. That is as much as you might spend for one of those big coffee drinks and this lasts virtually through a working career!! No remorse on this one!!

I received MS-80B model instead of MS-80S mentioned by the seller. The MS-80B is an upgraded version as it has additional buttons. Square root and play buttons have been added in the top row. See attached picture.This is a great calculator for small business or home office. I bought Casio MS-80TV almost 7 years ago and it still works great. Few years ago I picked up office max tax calculator from a local store and I always get frustrated while using it .The buttons in office max ones are crappy, poor build quality, and one has to put lot of pressure on buttons to make it work. Using office max calculator makes me appreciate the Casio calculator.The MS - 80B I just received looks magnificent. The build quality has greatly improved and it works flawlessly. The calculator has a high end appliance look and has exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended.

Beware! I fell for "Top Selling" Amazon title... and it broke after light use for less than 9 mos. It just kept putting in the number 9 when trying to add, subtract, times, divide, etc. For example, if I want to multiple 2x2, I would enter 2 then hit the X and then it would put "29" in my display. If I did 2+2 it would still but 29 in the display. 3x3 or 3-3 or 3/3 it would put 39 in the display and so on. Spoke to Casio's tech help desk and it was determined unfixable (even after being put on hold a little while as wanted to see if I could reset it somehow). It is now officially junk and the tech help never even heard of this problem...that is never good news. I thought Casio would be a good brand name so I would not have to deal with this type of problem...where are the simple good quality calculators at???
I could not see my other one in the light that I had for 4 years. This one you can see it in the sun Thanks Ray

Sometimes, a basic calculator is just the thing.  Calling up an Excel spreadsheet is often too time consuming for basic functions.  And if your phone or tablet happens to be off, it can take at least a minute to boot up.Casio cut its corporate teeth on basic and scientific calculators.  This one is modestly priced and will meet most of your day-to-day needs.A positive is that it uses solar power only - both indoor lights and outdoor sun.  The There are no batteries to replace.  The only downside is that there is no off switch.  You activate it on by pressing the AC key in the lower left corner.  The calculator will auto-shit down after a few minutes of non-use.  Seems it would have been pretty simple to also include an off button, but for the price I'm not complaining.
If you want just a basic calculator at budget price, this is the answer.for you.  It works just as advertised.

Can't believe I'm leaving a review for a cheap calculator! It might save someone the trouble of dealing with it though. It's a Casio, they make perfectly good calculators, but this one is a real dud! The "feature" regarding tax insinuates itself with everything else you try to do and you can never get it to clear in entirety. Really bothersome and frustrating; plowing through to get a simple calculation accomplished. The numbers went screwy after about a month of occasional use, only partially appearing on the screen. But that's not all, they also switch value! Unbelievable, but true. You press nine and it shows 9 on the screen, after you press another number that 9 turns into a 3... i kid you not. Into the trash. Definitely not a bargain for ten bucks! Save yourself some trouble.
I like the size of the calculator--big enough yet light to carry. The quality is good and it easy to use.

I bought one of these years ago at a store on a whim. Turns out, this is possibly the greatest simple desk calculator made. The quality of the buttons, the display, the battery - everything is great.A year or so ago I came looking to Amazon to pick up a few more (because people always steal mine), and they only had "newer" models. The newer calculators in the same line are NOT as good. I gave my wife a new one and she kept stealing the original.So today, while stealing my calculator back yet again, I do another search. Low and behold, here it is!Insta-buy.(It's not a magical calculator or anything, but it goes to show how many corners are cut for most things like this.)

I am writing this review not only for this calculator but for its predecessor, the Casio MS-80V which I have owned and used for 32 years and it has been used every day and has not failed.  AMAZING!!  The battery or the solar panel has never failed and all the buttons and functions still work!  If this is indicative of the future performance of this new model the MS-80B, which I have owned for about a week, I am certain that it will be a great product also......and it certainly seems so!  I give both of them 5 plus stars and highly recommend the purchase of the new model.  What product made today lasts without fail for 32 years!?.......Buy several of this new model before they run out and especially at this price!

Excellent and easy to use desktop calculator.  This is a must for everyone.For easy and quick calculations there could not be any better product out there.  The display is large and very easy to read.  It does not need batteries, and unlike other calculators that use solar it has another power source so it not neccessary to run to a lamp to power the calculator up or find a calcualtion just to have it go blank when you try to look at it.  The buttons are easy to use and leave enough space between other buttons so one does not end up punching numbers or opperations one did not intend.There are also handy tax and foreign currency  functions on the calculator along with a hand memory.

My desk calculator had finally given up on me, and I had that desk calculator since HIGHSCHOOL and I am a few years out of college already! But as all good things do come to an eventual end, my calculator did and when I went looking on amazon for a replacement, they sure don't make my few decades old calculator anymore, so I went with this one...and it's perfect for my needs. I guess it was about time for an upgrade as far as desktop calculators go. :) It's solar powered so I love how I don't have to worry about changing out the batteries...and it's fairly easy to turn on. The buttons are big enough...and I like the basic-ness of it.

How do you rate something like this?  It calculates.  That gives it 3 stars.  Presumably it is accurate, although the reason I bought the calculator in the first place is because I don't calculate very accurately without a calculator. The numbers are big, the keys are easy to find and they have sufficient space between them.  That helps eliminate errors.  Plus it is solar powered.  I have had a couple just like this one and they get borrowed and never returned, so that says good things in a roundabout way as well.

My husband and I are both fussy about calculators. We don't want a tiny one because we want our hands free, and we want a desktop version to be sturdy enough without being huge desk space hogs. This has been the answer for both of us. It has a sturdy feel to the keys when you use it, it stays put on the desk and doesn't "run away" as you're using it, but it's still portable enough to throw into my backpack for school on those "you will need a calculator" days.

This is a great value for a fine calculator.  Large number pads plus an easy to read display make this a terrific machine for seniors or those that spend a lot of time running numbers. The percent key is less than intuitive hence the 4 stars.  Once you figure it out it is ok but cumbersome. If you do a lot of currency conversions or need to add tax to a calculation those functions are quite handy.  All in all a super buy.

We are forever using calculators in our business.  We need the tax + - feature and we have several employees giving prices on items all at the same time.  Other calculators have gone the way of the world, but these keep going.  Have had one for 10 years and it is the best.  We are now repalcing all of the other brands because they just can't keep up with the constant use.It really is the best one out there!

I share the opinion of other reviewers here who lament that this calculator does not easily allow you to add percentages.  Furthermore, there were no instructions at all on using other features, except for some arcania about how to use it for currency exchanges and tax calculations.  I'm sending it back to Amazon.  I have a similar Canon calculator which is much better.

I am a freak who balances my checkbook every day via my online statement.  After a million years my old calculator died.  After reading about this honey I decided to give it a whirl.  I am very very pleased.  It is compact the keys are great for my stubby fingers and it actually adds and subtracts.  What more could one want for the price?  Try it, you'll like it...

Best calculator for small business out there.  Has a programmable tax button.  Low priced and easy to add up total sales with tax.  Nothing fancy, but durable and great to use.  Never had one stop working and I have purchased a lot over the years.  The only reason I have ever had to replace was an employee dropped it repeatedly, or they just got dirty over time.

This item did not work out of the box.  After being allowed to charge in the sunlight it still did not work.  Segments of the numbers would be partially visible and other segments would not be which made it impossible to determine what the number was.  Amazon was very quick and fair to take care of the problem.  Surprised that a Casio product would be so bad.

I have a smaller Casio calculator and it has worked beautifully for about 10 years.  I wanted this one to use at my computer when I was doing comparison shopping.  I wanted one that was user friendly, big enough to read easily and desk size.  This fits perfectly.  It has more features than I need but it is the perfect size and easy to read.  I am happy
To be used in the RV.

Giving this five stars because of its large screen size that doesn't seem conspicuous and annoying. Buttons are big and visible enough for people who have low muscle memory. If you run out of batteries, it has a little solar panel that absorbs energy from the sun. Casio is always, and will have the best footing in the calculator industry.

I have one in my office and one at home.  I use both on a daily basis.  I have plenty of other options (like my phone, my computer, etc), but this calculator is there at the ready for balancing my check book, calculating my quality data rates, or doing whatever math I need done.  The angle is perfect, and the buttons are large and simple.

Can't do without this thing.  Kids gave me a new-fangled scientific calculator for Christmas, and it's too complicated to use.  This is nice and simple and straightforward.  It's intuitive.  Feels sturdy.  The numbers are nice and big, and it has all the basic functions I use most.  Wish it had square root, but I'm just being picky.

This is exactly what I was looking for.  I do not need a paper tape. This is the best size for my use and the buttons as well as the display are clear and legible. I would have preferred it to have an "OFF" button just to save the battery but my previous unit worked the same... turns off by itself after a couple of minutes.

Although there are many calculators that are cheaper,  this is the only one I could find that does not have a square root function key. Standardized state testing does not allow students to use a calculator with a square root function.  The larger size buttons make it easier for my students that struggle with fine motor skills.

I can only give this unit two stars because even though it's appearance was quite satisfactory, it was inoperable.  Perhaps if I had been able to actually power this unit up I would have been able to give it a better rating.  As always, the return/refund process went smoothly and was very simple, and i give that five stars!

Unfortunately I got a bad one. It worked fine the first few days and then two pixel lines on the first digit stop working. (the bottom left and bottom lines) So typing a 2 would only show the top half, a Zero would look like a 7.On the plus side, Amazon has got our back. They refunded the item without a hassle.

Bought two of these calculators for our lodge business office so we could have one at each desk.  They work great and like that the readout screen is tilted for easier viewing.  Also like that they are dual powered to save on battery life.  For our business, being able to set the tax rate up is a bonus.

My dad wears glasses to read and I wanted to buy him a calculator for his rental business that he didn't need his glasses to read, was solar powered (my parents have a hard time finding batteries in their house), and had big buttons for his big fingers. He says he loves it. Old man approves. 5 stars.

Pros:Large display charactersLarge, smooth key size and functionReally like function display (when adding or subtracting etc, that function shows + or - on the display)Cons:None yetHave tried many of these over the years and so far this is top notch for my needs.

Just a good desktop calculator that works well and is easy to read. I say desktop because I think it's better suited to that with the angled view, larger physical size and lack of cover versus a "backpack" style. The button spacing makes it easier to quickly key in digits without error.

This is just what I wanted for doing taxes, adding up household expenses, etc.  The keyboard is smooth to operate, big enough to see well even without my glasses but not so big as to be ridiculous.  It is angled so the display is easy to see while it sits on my desk.  Great little calculator.

This is such an important item to have around the house that I didn't realize it until I got it. It looks good and it's big enough to see the numbers and even typing is very easy and to top it of is it fits big fingers,seriously. I have little tiny hands but my friend loves that calculator.

My kiddo's calculator died and we ordered this one at Christmas time.  Between the two of us, this gets used just about everyday.  It's the perfect size -- small enough to fit in a desktop, but large enough that we can hit the buttons quickly and accurately.  Thrilled with this product.

This is a very old fashioned calculator. I'm pretty sure it's been around for a very long time. BUT it is the BEST calculator. We had one of these at work and I really wanted one for myself. They're set up sort of like an adding machine so they are very easy to use. Anyway, I love it!

I wanted 4 desktop calculators so employees could easily add and subtract GST from sales, given that some inputs include GST and others don't, depending on the GST status of the supplier or nature of the supply.  This Casio calculator does the job well.  It's easy to set the GST rate.
was bigger than I thought it would be

LeighIf you read the description you will see it is the perfect basic computer. Its good looking, space saving, dual powered, has large easy to read keys and large digital display. What more can you ask for? Casio has been around for a long time and the price is right.

it's a calculator and it calculates. I simply needed to replace one that stopped workling. This one is compact and the display characters are about 9/16 of an inch high. I do not need my reading glasses to use this thing. It has all the functions that an average person would need.

Should've purchased this long ago. (Too many years of eye strain with smaller unit.) Does everything I need it to do for finances, online purchases (tax key is so handy!), crafting, etc. Calculator is perfect size, and keys are just large enough I can use my old 10-key skills. :)

This was a great gift for my 6 year old granddaughter. She loves using it and there are no batteries to replace!!  She picked up my solar calculator and loved putting in numbers. I thought she should have her own. It was inexpensive and a great gift she will use for many years

Purchased 4 of these for adults with disabilities.  The number and keys were large and easy to touch.  After 5 months they continue to work on math problems and feel inspired that they are learning something with a new way of doing math.  These clients range from 20 to 62.

Excellent medium size desktop calculator.  The buttons are a nice size with a soft (& quiet) feel and it does everything a basic calculator needs to do. It also has a nice size solar panel as well as a good responsive contrast display.  Great buy at a great price.

I've dropped this, smacked it onto the side of my desk, sat on it..... all accidentally of coarse :-).  This little guy still feels sturdy and ready for more.  The numbers and the keys are a good size for entering numbers quickly and reading the results quickly.

This is a perfect little desk calculator for average use.  It's 4x5 inches, so it fits nicely but is easy to find among the papers and files.  Operation is simple and the keypad is big enough to use one-handed without resorting to a pencil or pen.  I'm pleased.

I especially like the sales tax memory key function.  It makes it much easier to calculate taxes or percentages in general.  The size of the numbers is just right for me - big is better.  The only downside is portability.  It's a desktop calculator after all.

The product was much smaller than I thought based on the picture.  This is a nice calculator though.  I originally bought the product to be a desktop calculator, but it was too small and only 8 digits.  I ended up buying a 12 digit model instead.

Had the same calculator for at least 10 years and one day it starting making mistakes. Went to Amazon and there it was! Was so pleased I bought two of them because my husband "borrows" mine all the time. Works as well as the original.

This is a very nice, compact calculator with large, easy-to-read numbers. It also runs on solar as well as a replaceable battery, and has a 3-digit comma marker.  Best of all, it's inexpensive. Puts those dollar-store calculators to shame.

Keys are nice and big. Placement of keys are perfect for average hands/fingers. It would be better if there was an off button to help make the battery last longer. My old one died after 2 years of daily usage. Battery would not charge.

works for what I have to do at work figuring work offsets. Simple adding, subtracting, multiplying and dividing. Nothing fancy, but works. Screen is big and easy to view. Automatically shuts off by itself after a while of non usage.

This solar calculator works well, is cheaply priced, but the quality is there.  it is not the smallest and certainly not the largest, but it is perfect for my desk top.  And at this price i can spill all the coffee on it i want!

I bought this for my 94 year old mother.  She was using an old adding machine and it finally "lost its life".  I ordered this because of the larger numbers and display screen.  My mother says it works perfectly for her.

This calculator is large enough to see easily, the buttons are large enough to be comfortable for my husband to use and it's simple enough that I don't need to puzzle over how it works. Love the no-nonsense of this. Thank you!

My husband uses these calculators quite a bit for work. The keys are easy to press and do not stick. Numbers are easy to read and he keeps one in his truck and I hasn't melted or shown any sign of wear because of the hot/cold.

What is there to say?  This calculator works well and is a good value for the price.  I like the fact that it is solar.  Even though computers have calculators on them, sometime it's easier to use an old fashioned calculator.

I love this calculator so much that I've purchased it twice. I really liked it. I had it the first time for about 7 years and the solar part stopped working. So, I bought a new one. Love it. It has a nice bright display.

Very good calculator for business transactions. Have been using these for 4 years straight, and they're still going. I bought this one because I needed an extra one. Easy to set up currency exchange and tax +- option.

Works perfectly and you can't beat it for the price.I had a similar one, and the battery finally died after 10+ years, so I picked upthis one as it was very similar to what I had.  I love this calculator!

I over researched for this calculator.  I use this at work for simple arithmetic.  If you are looking for a simple, regular calculator, there's no need to look elsewhere.  The numbers are big enough and easy to read.

and needed to get a new one.  It is just like my other one and the price was really cheap.  It is very easy to use, does not require any batteries  and now I know where to go when I need items of this type - AMAZON.

I am somewhat disappointed with the functions.  No "clear entry, memory recall, square root" for example.  And the monetary conversion is kind of useless unless you are always using the same two currencies.

This is my fault for not looking closer but.....this thing has no root key! I assumed even the most basic calculator this size would have that function, hurts to be proven wrong. Other than that, it is what it is.

These are basically cheap in price for the product you get, so I got it to replace one that I have had for a few years. Letters and numbers are of bigger size so you can see them without squinting your eyes...lol

Some large calculators are cheap and have keys that stick.  Not this one.  The tax function is a helpful addition.  I bought a chain store calculator recently, and needed up throwing it out.  This one works well.

Arrived on time.  Looks like the image.  Functions like it suppose to.  Ergonomic and aesthetically pleasing.  Good deal.Buy this calculator if you need an efficient device to do your basic functions.

Good conservative looking adornment for your desk. It seems accurate, not that I would know if it wasn't, or else I wouldn't have needed it. Nice bold, easy to read numbers. Solar powered, too. Good buy!

I needed to replace my old calculator and I am very happy with this.  I use it for balancing my checkbook, bank statements and just regular things that require basic math.  No fancy hard math for me. :)
This is great calculator.  I can touch type on it.  The buttons are effortless and reassuring.  The screen is clear.  It has a built in battery or solar power.  Perfectly suited for everyday needs.
I got this to replace a garbage staples calculator which half of the buttons would not come back up when pressed.  This calculator is exactly what I needed for everyday calculations at my desk.
When I was in business doing the billing, I used one of these all the time. I decided to get another one has my old one was lost in a move. It is a great piece of work- easy to use and read.
Casio continues to put out a great product at an affordable price... humbly making their electronics that perform complicated tasks simply for all thumbs people like me... Thanks Casio!!
Very nice large calculator that I use at home and at work. It is easy to use and easy to see. The large numbers are great. It helps me do accounting at work and study for exams.
Perfect for my everyday use, good size digits, keys don't stick, rubber foot prevent calculator from sliding away, nothing fancy, just a nice simple calculator at a good price.
I've had a similar model at my office and bought this for home front.....happy with purchase.  Like the tax tab for quick calculations when buying locally to know final price.
Sometimes I like to just have a calculator in front of me, separate from the rest of my devices.  This is a simple but functional calculator that gets a lot of use at my job.
Good solid calculator.  Nice size for my house and small office.  Buttons a crisp and don't stick.  Display is bright and readable.  Just a good solid calculator, well built.
I have owned two of these calculators. The first one lasted 10+ years of constant use. I replaced it with a store brand knockoff; it lasted 2 months. Back to Casio for me.
Casio did not fail me, they consistently give you a great product for a great price. No big bells and whistles, perfect for calculations on the go and well made as always.
Good, simple calculator with easily read details.  Good price delivered to my door which is better than forgetting a new one EVERY time when I was at the store. ;-)
